--- title: "Open files" author: "Karen C. Goncalves dos Santos" callout-appearance: simple date: "3 November 2023" categories: - "R basics" - Input files format: html --- ## Basic `read.XXXX` and tidyverse `read_XXXX` ### `read.XXX` These functions are available without loading any package `````{=html}
Function Column separation Decimal separation
read.csv sep = "," dec = "."
read.csv2 sep = ";" dec = ","
read.delim sep = "\t" (tab) dec = "."
read.delim2 sep = "\t" (tab) dec = ","
````` ### `read_XXX` These functions are available after loading `tidyverse`. They are the equivalent of the `read.XXXX`, but are faster and so better for big datasets. Note that they produce `tibbles`, not `data.frames`. Though similar, `tibbles` do not have row names. If your first column has no name because it contains row names, R will replace the empty cell with `...1`. You use `col_names` to indicate if there are column names or to give a vector with the column names. `````{=html}
Function Column separation Decimal separation
read_csv sep = "," dec = "."
read_csv2 sep = ";" dec = ","
read_delim sep = "\t" (tab) dec = "."
read_delim2 sep = "\t" (tab) dec = ","
`````
